column4: Hmm, Anyone want to help me troubleshoot my tftp server..i can send files to it form the same machine just not from another machine in the network...
firewall settings have 20,21,69 wide open on both machines
yep, i was able to send a file to the server from the same comp the server was on, just cant from another host in the network... i think its permissions/auth but im not sure
ok, are you wanting a ftp server of are you using this to actually host boot images on the tftp server
use this as a house for cisco IOS images so i can upgrade the IOS
you are running thin is daemon mode yes? i.e. you have a startup script in /etc/init.d
I did sudo service xinetd start
that's what I used. It worked from the same host the server is on just not from another node =[

Allow new files to be created. By default, tftpd will only allow upload of files that already exist. Files are created with default permissions allowing anyone to read or write them, unless the -p or -U options are specified.
you neet the "-c" option in the xinetd config
